attributes.action: Fund the NHS with an additional £350 million per week as promised by Brexit.
attributes.additional_details: Boris Johnson was responsible for the promise during the campaign and as the current Prime Minister, he has the power to honour this promise.
attributes.background: During the 2016 Brexit referendum, the vote leave campaign promised to use the £350 million EU saving to provide additional funding for the NHS instead. The UK Government should honour that promise, especially in light of the under-funding exposed by the pandemic.

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: 

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/327376

You may be interested to know that the Government has introduced a new law that will increase funding for the NHS by £33.9 billion a year (in cash terms) by 2023/24. You can find out more here: https://services.parliament.uk/Bills/2019-21/nhsfunding.html
